multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a rash on my trunk that started with one large pink spot and has spread to smaller spots, and it's a bit itchy.
How long ago did this rash first appear?
The rash first appeared 3 weeks ago.
Have you had any recent illnesses, like a sore throat or a cold, before the rash appeared?
No, I haven't had any recent illnesses.
Do you have any history of skin issues or allergies?
No, I've been healthy without any history of skin issues or allergies.
Is the rash scaly and located mostly on your trunk? Does it seem to follow any specific pattern, like a Christmas tree?
Yes, the rash is scaly and located mostly on my trunk, but there's no mention of it following a pattern like a Christmas tree.
Has anyone in your family ever had a similar rash or any known skin conditions?
No, no one in my family has had a similar rash or any known skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Pityriasis Rosea
